description: As part of an initiative for reproductive health care access, advocacy groups handed out emergency contraception pills and condoms to fans at the Olivia Rodrigo concert in St. Louis on Tuesday night.
title: Olivia Rodrigo concertgoers got a show — and free emergency contraceptives

description: In 2023, 7.6% of U.S. adults said they align themselves with the LGBTQ+ community, compared to 3.5% in 2012, the first year Gallup collected such metrics. That figure has grown every year since 2012.
title: The number of U.S. adults who identify as LGBTQ+ doubled in 12 years, new poll shows

description: "More than anything, I believe he would want others to know they are capable of great things," Alexander's friend Christopher Ulmer told NPR.
title: Paul Alexander, forced into an iron lung by polio in 1952, dies at 78

description: Boost confidence, joy and add movement to your life with these creative and science-backed actions.
title: 9 energizing ideas that can put a spring in your step

description: Kate Manne tried to shrink her body for years before embracing her size as part of a "natural, normal human variation." She says the fight against fat phobia must start in the doctor's office.
title: In 'Unshrinking,' a writer argues that the medicalization of fatness leads to bias

description: The children were moved out of Rafah by the charity SOS Children's Villages International with the help of the German government. But the transfer has sparked anger among some hardliners in Israel.
title: 68 orphans were evacuated from Gaza to the West Bank, enraging Israel's far right

description: The House will vote on a bill that would force TikTok to divest from its Chinese parent company or else face a ban from U.S. app stores. The first ship carrying food to Gaza is on its way from Cyprus.
title: Congress mulls another TikTok ban; An aid ship heads to Gaza as hunger worsens

description: The House is set to vote Wednesday on a bill that would force parent company ByteDance to sell TikTok or face a ban of the social media app on U.S. devices.
title: House expected to approve bill forcing TikTok to either be sold or face a U.S. ban

description: The formula for resolving the Israeli-Palestinian conflict has long called for negotiating a Palestinian state. What if that were reversed and a state were declared first and then negotiated later?
title: A radical Mideast proposal: What if the U.S. recognized a Palestinian state now?

description: Authors say that the proliferation of AI-generated books can lead customers into buying the wrong book on Amazon and that these books can harm authors' sales numbers and reputations.
title: Authors push back on the growing number of AI 'scam' books on Amazon

description: To run for president as an independent candidate, conspiracy theorist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. needs to get on ballots, a complicated and expensive state-by-state undertaking.
title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. wants to get on the ballot in all 50 states. It won't be easy

description: Hundreds of GitHub users were notified after the media outlet sent takedown notices to coders it believed violated its copyright on the game.
title: C-e-a-s-e and desist: 'The New York Times' goes after Wordle spin-offs

description: The House is gearing up for a Wednesday vote on legislation that could lead to a ban on one of the most widely used apps in the world, with an estimated 170 million users in the United States alone.
title: Content creators blast a potential TikTok ban

description: The false notion that undocumented immigrants affect federal elections has a long history. But this year, due in part to rising migration at the U.S. southern border, the idea could have new potency.
title: Conservatives are warning about noncitizens voting. It's a myth with a long history

description: From why you need them to how to check if they're legit, here's a guide to everything you need to know about eclipse glasses so you can view next month's rare total solar eclipse safely.
title: A stargazer's guide to solar eclipse glasses

description: The pickle-shaped bottom feeders may reduce the amount of microbes on the seafloor that could potentially sicken coral, scientists suggest
title: The lowly sea cucumber may be helping to protect coral reefs against disease

description:
"Long COVID has affected every part of my life," said Virginia resident Rachel Beale said at a recent Senate hearing. "I wake up every day feeling tired, nauseous and dizzy. I immediately start planning when I can lay down again."

Beale is far from alone. Many of her experiences have been echoed by others dealing with long COVID. It's a constellation of debilitating symptoms that range from brain fog and intense physical fatigue to depression and anxiety.

But there's new, promising research that sheds light onto some symptoms. NPR health correspondent Will Stone talks with Short Wave host Regina G. Barber about the state of long COVID research — what we know, what we don't and when we can expect treatments or even cures for it.

Have more COVID questions you want us to cover? Email us at
title: What we know about long COVID — from brain fog to physical fatigue

description: We've probably said it a hundred times on Code Switch — biological race is not a real thing. So why is race still used to help diagnose certain conditions, like keloids or cystic fibrosis? On this episode, Dr. Andrea Deyrup breaks it down for us, and unpacks the problems she sees with practicing race-based medicine.
title: In the world of medicine, race-based diagnoses are still very real

description: A Navalny spokesperson said the assailant smashed a window of Leonid Volkov's car, sprayed tear gas into his eyes and started hitting him with a hammer in Lithuania's capital.
title: The top strategist of late Russian opposition leader Navalny is attacked in Lithuania

description: The Pentagon will rush about $300 million in weapons to Ukraine after finding some cost savings in its contracts, even though the military remains deeply overdrawn.
title: Pentagon to give Ukraine $300 million in weapons
